law.catch_line: Malt beverage supplier's license authorizing importation of malt beverages -- Nonresident entities eligible for license -- Licenses and limited licenses -- Exemption from notice requirements of KRS 243.360.

text.section:
An out-of-state brewer, distributor, importer for a brewer, or importer of a non-United States brand of malt beverage may obtain a malt beverage supplier's license for importing a malt beverage product into Kentucky if it is:
Licensed to do business in the state in which it is located; and
Registered with the Kentucky Department of Revenue.

An entity listed in subsection (1) of this section who wishes to import more than twenty-five thousand (25,000) barrels or seven hundred seventy-five thousand (775,000) gallons of malt beverage shall:
Apply for an out-of-state malt beverage supplier's license on an application provided by the department;
Submit documentation required by the application; and
Pay the annual fee required by KRS 243.040.

An entity listed in subsection (1) of this section who wishes to import less than twenty-five thousand (25,000) barrels or seven hundred seventy-five thousand (775,000) gallons of malt beverage shall:
Apply for a limited out-of-state malt beverage supplier's license on an application provided by the department;
Submit documentation required by the application; and
Pay an annual fee required by KRS 243.040.
An out-of-state applicant shall be exempt from the notice requirements of KRS 243.360.

law.history: Created 2013 Ky. Acts ch. 121, sec. 34, effective June 25, 2013.
